events.name: The StoneHack Challenge
events.about:
Three one day hackathons where devs are challenged to build prototypes from teachers suggestions. At BETT 2013 - Stone Group stand (C70).

Dates of the hackathon are:

  • Wednesday 30th January 
  • Thursday 31st January
  • Friday 1st February

From 10am to 5pm each day.

Pls note: Participants must sign up for free tickets to the exhibition hall here: http://www.bettshow.com/Visiting
events.address: One Western Gateway Royal Victoria Dock

events.name: London Sanitation Hackathon
events.about:
The London Sanitation Hackathon is part of a global event that brings together technologists and sanitation sector experts to develop innovative solutions to challenges in accessing sanitation. The event, sponsored globally by the World Bank, and in partnership with Water and Sanitation for the Urban Poor (WSUP) in London, will take place simultaneously in cities around the world on December 1-2. 

The Sanitation Hackathon challenges programmers to develop innovative software solutions that address real-world problems in sanitation. During the months leading up to the event, subject matter experts and members of the public will create, submit and vote on problem definitions that highlight specific sanitation challenges that could be mitigated by innovative ICTs. Then, during a weekend-long marathon event, teams of programmers in cities around the world will develop innovative solutions to these problem definitions. 

HOW TO GET INVOLVED:

If you work in the field of sanitation or are a technologist that can contribute to the development of problem definitions beforehand, please contact LondonSanHack@gmail.com. The problem definitions will be posted at sanitationhackathon.com prior to the event, and we encourage you to check them out. 

We welcome people with a range of technology skills and knowledge of the sanitation sector to join us for the event- just sign up (attendance is free) to hold your spot. 

WHAT TO KNOW:

Food and beverages will be provided throughout the weekend (but if you have special dietary requirements beyond vegetarian, please bring your own). 

We ask that you bring your own laptop, power supply, innovative thinking, team spirit and sense of humour. 

Judges from the tech and sanitation sectors will apply criteria to award 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place prizes, which will include opportunities to further develop prototypes. 

Please contact LondonSanHack@gmail.com with any questions.

events.name: Unilever presents Health & Wellness Hackathon @LondonBSchool
events.about:
AND

WANT TO

MAKE THE WORLD HEALTHIER

London Business School is happy to present this HEALTH & WELLNESS HACKATHON sponsored by Unilever HeartAge.

We want to contribute to the Health & Wellness entrepreneurial and development environment in the UK, generate ideas for Health & Wellness apps, products & services and, also, introduce the HEARTAGE API to the developers’ world.

WHEN:

– Start: Friday November 30th 2012, 6pm

– End: Sunday December 2nd 2012, 4pm

WHERE: 

– London Business School

WHO:

– 60 entrepreneurs/students/developers interested in health & wellness

– 10 industry experts as mentors

– 4 industry experts as judges 

PRIZES:

– 1st prize: £1,000

– Runner-up: £500

– Best app using HeartAge API: £1,500 (can be accumulated to the other prizes) and follow-up discussion with Unilever

AGENDA:

– November 30th, 2012

6-6.30pm: Registration

6.30-7.30pm: Welcome and introduction to APIs, Hackathon, HeartAge, Unilever

7.30-9pm: Idea pitching, teams formation, nibbles

9pm: Hackathon starts

– December 1st, 2012

9am-7pm: Development (after coffee and pastries).

Throughout the day there will be ongoing mentoring by industry experts and API providers. Refreshments, sandwiches and pizzas will be catered.

7-8pm: Interim presentations

– December 2nd, 2012

9am-12.30pm: Development (after coffee and pastries)

12.30-2pm: Sit-down lunch

2-3.30pm: Final pitches

3.30-4pm: Awards, closure.

Further info on HEARTAGE

http://www.heartagecalculator.com

events.name: Teenweb Hackathon
events.about:
Starting from 12PM on Saturday 24th November and continuing through to 12PM on Saturday 25th November, youll be working around the clock to produce a working prototype of your web, mobile or desktop application AND a marketable business strategy accompanying it.

With industry volunteers available on the day for guidance, all meals provided and prizes that promise to be Awesome, we definitely hope youll take the opportunity to join us.

Therell be plenty of goodies to be had on the day too.

Check us our on Twitter or on Facebook to find out more.

www.teenwebhack.com

events.name: Student Upstarts Business Hackathon
events.about:
Why? Because we believe that students will create the best companies for the future - be your own boss and do it right now.

What? A Student Upstarts business hackathon - pitch ideas, form teams and build a business - all in one weekend.

Where? The offices of Entepreneur First, 111 Canon Street, London, EC4N 5AR. Map URL.

The format:

- Join fellow entrepreneurial students who are interested in starting their own company to discuss ideas, form teams then create a business over the weekend.

- The aim is to build the best MVP and pitch this on Sunday afternoon to a judging panel.

- Christian and Matthew, the co-founders of Student Upstarts, will be there all weekend to mentor teams on how and why to build an MVP and to answer queries on what makes an investable business as well as the Student Upstarts plans for the rest of 2012.

- Students from the teams weve backed so far will also be there to answer any questions too.

- Whats included: Red Bull, Pizza and a few of beers to celebrate on Sunday.

-- Hosted by Christian Jakenfelds & Matthew Stafford --

-- Student Upstarts - up to £15,000 investment into student teams to create and grow businesses --

events.name: Ideate with Unilever in Health and Wellness
events.about:
Are you looking for potential cofounders to work on ideas on the wellbeing space? Are you passionate about industries such as health, sport, beauty and food, and are you looking to identify an opportunity to work in?

Do you want to know what is Unilever looking for in areas such as Health and Wellness?

Founders Fit is running a full day Ideation day with Unilever in the areas of Health and Wellness. The event will bring together talented designers, technologists and business people to explore the opportunities to exploit Univers IPA related to health and wellbeing.

In this Ideate event, Unilever will show and open their HeartAge API to the entrepreneurs attending the event. During the day, cross disciplinary teams of 4-6 entrepreneurs and experts will generate ideas or products, applications and services that can be implement with the help of the HeartAge Tool. At the end of the day, the teams will present the ideas in front of a panel of experts, including some Unilever representatives. The best 10 ideas will be selected to be developed in a hackathon the first weekend in December.

What is the event format?

Participants will have the opportunity to meet innovators from Unilever and from other companies and startups related to health and wellness industry. They will also have the change to get new ideas for potential new businesses.

Who should attend:
- Entrepreneurs starting companies in the well-being space (i.e. food, health, sport/fitness, beauty,...)
- Entrepreneurs looking to join startups in the any of these industries
- Professionals passionate for the well-being space, looking to create solutions to help people improve their health and quality of life
 
Agenda of the day:
12pm - 12.30 - registration and lunch
12.30pm - 1pm - rules of the game
1pm - 2pm - speed meetings with industry experts and pitches from industry experts (including Health 2.0 guys and Unilever guys)
2pm - 5pm - ideation (based on halfway milestones)
5pm - 6pm - final presentation of ideas in front of experts panel
6pm - selection of the ideas to be developed in the  hackathon

events.name: Midata Hackathon 2012
events.about:
More and more data is being generated which contains information about the choices that we make. Businesses use this data to develop new products and services, but so far consumers have not been able to access it or use it easily. By giving consumers the ability to request their data electronically, the UK governments midata strategy helps give power back to consumers. Accessing data about their previous consumption/transactions, and thus their purchasing and consumption behaviour, can help them make better decisions in the future.

The Midata Hackathon 2012 is all about exploring whats possible when consumers have access to their data. Come along and join developers, designers, and domain experts to build new apps that empower consumers in radical new ways.

Visit the website at http://theodi.org/events/midata-hackathon-2012 for full details and schedule.

events.name: AngelHack Fall 2012 London
events.about:
Ready to take your big idea to the next level? Then join us for Londons next AngelHack, where winning teams will receive 6-8 weeks of mentorship and be flown into Silicon Valley for a weekend of events including a Global Demo Day to A-list investors and media, Site visits to, Google, Facebook, Google Ventures, VIP dinners, and ragging parties with the Valley startup community. This is not your typical weekend hackathon! This is the big leagues! This is AngelHack and you cant afford to miss it.

AngelHack Fall 2012 Fast Facts
  • 2500 amazing developers & designers in 11 cities for you to work with
  • Great food, shwag, nerf guns, helicopters, and awesomness all around
  • Over $650,000 in prizes, including trips to Silicon Valley for the top 25 teams
  • Media coverage and all star investor judges to help validate those whacky hack ideas of yours
WANT 50 FREE CARDS FROM MOO FOR YOUR ANGELHACK LONDON PROJECT?

What should I build?
Create a prototype (hack) of something that you believe solves a big problem. You dont need a business plan or anything crazy like that, but you should be able to show the big idea potential of your hack. AngelHack is a launchpad for you to flush out and validate projects youve always wanted to build. Previous winners include: Appetas, GiveGo, TapFame, SnapStore, ShareBrowse, Kloutron, & Blue Dragon Security.

What are the rules?
All code must be FRESH. Prior to the hackathon you can create your design, wireframes, logo, and user flows. You can even build hardware. But to make things completely fair you can not write any code whatsoever until the hackathon starts. All code must be built at AngelHack.

For more info visit our Rules and FAQ pages.

Good Luck,
Gregory Gopman
AngelHack Founder / CEO

As seen in

events.name: Grails48 - London
events.about: Grails48 is a global community hackathon series and startup mentorship program. Our first event newbie is taking place Nov 9-11th, 2012 online and in various locations. The purpose of Grails48 is to bring the Grails world together igniting innovation with our favorite JVM based tools and platforms.

events.name: TechMeetups Hackathon: Mobile Apps #tmuhack
events.about:
TechMeetups Hackathon: Mobile Apps #tmuhack

9-11 November

venue tbc

For all developers, designers, ideas people interested in hacking Mobile apps for any platform!
 
Who’s it for?

  • Developers who have their own app idea or want to help someone build a prototype for any mobile platform.

  • Designers who have their own app idea or want to help a team create the best-looking app of the weekend.
  • Anyone else who either has an app idea or wants to join a team – every project needs a marketer or biz dev to create an app to take the market by storm.

What’s happening?
TechMeetups is holding a hackathon competition for those who want to get together and hack a prototype app in just 48 hours!

  • Friday evening: pitch your idea (or choose your favourite project from the pitches), form a team, hack a prototype and pitch it to our judges on Sunday night for the chance to win some great prizes to help launch your app on the market!
  • entors will be on hand to help you with all your dev and business development questions.

 

For a video about the last hackathon hosted by TechMeetups in London see: http://crave.cnet.co.uk/mobiles/android-and-ios-app-olympics-held-in-london-in-video-50007159/

** we also allow observers to attend the hackathon during the Friday night pitch session and judging on Sunday night.  To be an observer simply register for the relevant ticket **

WHAT STANDS BETWEEN YOU AND THE PRIZE?

Teams must submit working prototypes for judging on Sunday which will be judged by our jury.

Friday
6pm Doors open and networking
7pm Presentations
7:30pm App idea presentations
8pm Teams form & the competition begins

Saturday
The hackathon continues
1pm Lunch
2pm Teams continue hacking!
6pm Video checkpoints

Sunday
The hackathon continues
1pm Lunch
2pm The final stretch!
6pm Presentations
6:30pm Judging
7pm Winners announced

WANT TO JOIN IN BUT HAVE QUESTIONS? READ ON...

What do I need to be an idea generator?
You can be anyone with an app idea who wants to build a team and prototype.  If you’re a developer, come and find the designer and marketer for your project.  If you’re business minded, find developers and designers to bring your idea to life.

Can I work on an existing app idea?
Yes, you can work on an app idea that you and even your business has already researched, but you should not bring along ideas that you’ve already started coding – the weekend is all about building the all-important prototype.

What platforms can I develop for?
Whatever purpose you wish to build your app prototype for, TechMeetups and our mentors there to support you in building it!

Do I need to have a certain level of experience to get involved?
No, the hackathon is about learning as well as applying your skills so you can get involved no matter how experienced you are.

What’s expected of me over the weekend?
You’ll get most out of the weekend by joining a team and building a working prototype of your app over the weekend.  We’ll have plenty of mentors, both technical and business oriented, who can help you to use new tools and APIs, as well as help you evaluate how attractive and sticky your app is looking.

What should I bring?
Your enthusiasm, your portable computer, the mobile device you’re building for and your camera to immortalize the making of your application!

What is the judging criteria for theapps?
The apps will be judged on their usability, innovation, business potential and execution.

Who owns the apps created?
The apps are owned solely by their creators – we’ll provide you with some terms which you can use so your team knows where they all stand. Do note that we do not get involved legally so it is important that you discuss this with your team before you start on the prototype so everyone is clear on ownership.

SPONSORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES

Through TechMeetups’ growing global network of tech communities, the month of November will be the time when our 4,000+ members around the world are talking about mobile apps and hackathons at www.techmeetups.com and via social media channels.

If you’re interested in promoting your company throughout the month, here’s more about what you can expect:

As a Sponsor of the TechMeetups.com Hackathon: Mobile Apps month your brand will have both local and global exposure.  Our event attendees will be developers, designers, entrepreneurs and those interested in innovative technologies and tools for the purpose of growing their business or projects.

TechMeetups.com’s global audience has the same profile and is located across the USA, Europe and Asia where we have active and fast-growing networks.

Through our reach we’ll be marketing the event to the entire TechMeetups global community of over 4,000 members across all these cities.  For more information about our reach and activities, please visit www.techmeetups.com

Email us at sponsor@techmeetups.com for more details.

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows -- London, Canada
events.about:
Be part of the app revolution!

By registering, you’ll be joining thousands of developers worldwide as we build apps for the next generation of Windows.

Expert Help, Free Resources

Microsoft app experts, developers and trainers will be available on-site to assist your learning and coding. Learn about building Windows Store apps today – download the info, tools and resources you need now. 

Windows Azure Mobile Services

Does your Store app idea include cloud services or storage? Check out Get started withMobile Services –registered student WOWZAPP 2012 participants are eligible for a FREE student Windows Azure six-month subscription!– supplies are limited so be sure to register now!
events.address: Western University Community College Room 37 340 UCC Building

events.name: Augmented Planet - The Leading UK Augmented Reality Event
events.about:
Now in its 4th year, Augmented Planet is back with our annual 2 day augmented reality conference. If you’re a developer, brand, digital agency or just have passion for augmented reality then this is the years must attend event.

Augmented Planted 2012
Augmented Planet takes place over 2 days in London on the 30th and 31st October (2012).

Day 1 is aimed at developers, agencies and anyone who is interested in how to create augmented reality, image recognition and face tracking applications. The afternoon will feature Augmented Planets first HackAR with opportunities to team up with other delegates and create an AR application from scratch. Create something good and your team might just win a prize.
 
You don’t need to be a developer to take part in the HackAR, all skills will be required. It’s the perfect way to get involved and meet new people.
 
Day 2 of Augmented Planet is focused on the business of AR. Here you’ll have the opportunity to hear from the leaders in the industry and see AR in action. Everything from mobile, eCommerece, glasses, AR & arts through to AR for the big stage. We have the A-Z of AR covered.

Agenda (For more information on the agenda click here)

Day 1 – The Developer Day

09:30-10:00      Registration & Arrival
10:00-10:15      Welcome & Introduction
10:15-10:45      Developing With Wikitude’s New Image Recognition API
10:45-11:15      D’Fusion Mobile SDK
11:15-11:45      Junaio’s new API – HTML5 and 3D Tracking
11:45-12:15      ARLabs Vision Technologies
12:15-12:45     To Be Annouced
12:45-13:45      Lunch
13:45-19:00      HackAR

Day 2 – The AR Day

09:30-10:00       Awards & HackAR Results
10:00-11:20       AR Demo Showcase: The Best Of AR
11:30-12:00       Co-evolution of Future AR Mobile Platforms
12:00-12:30       DIY Project Glass And What We Can Achieve Now And In The future?
12:30-13:30       Lunch
13:30-14:00      AR Studio – Augmented Reality Witchcraft For The Big Stage
14:00-14:30      AR and eCommerece
14:30-15:00      AR and the AR:Tz
15:00-15:30      Break
15:30-16:45      Panel: Choosing the right AR tool
16:15-16:45      Zappar
16:45-17:15      To Be Announced
17:15-17:30      Wrap Up

If you’re interested in AR, you can’t afford to miss this event.

 Augmented Planet 2012 is sponsored by:

 

 

 

 

 

 Media Sponsors:

events.name: Autumn Hackathon
events.about:
The Autumn Hackathon 2012 at the Google Campus, London,  will  focus  on building apps  to make learning fun, memorable and cool: for teachers, tools to help them focus on creativity in education; for pupils, fun ways (eg simulations, games, animation) to engage with the world of knowledge. The tagline for the  event is apps for teaching and learning. Lead sponsors are Pearsons Developer Unit, RIM Blackberry and 5Apps.

Developers may build with whichever tools they choose. They may create apps  natively, from APIs or using templates. 

A panel of senior developers and investors will judge the apps produced over the weekend and award Lots of cool prizes for winning teams. In addition, the creators of two of the winning prototypes which show some commercial promise may be invited to the App Development Lab of Coventry Universitys Serious Games Institute for further development work on their apps.

Lots of cool prizes for winning teams.

Dates: 27/28 October 2012
Venue: The Google Campus, 4-5 Bonhill Street, London EC2A 4BX 
Web: http://hackathoncentral.com. 
Register on Lanyrd here: lanyrd.com/chkhc 
Organiser: Milverton Wallace
Contact: milverton@gmail.com

events.name: TV Hackfest 2012
events.about:
Bringing Technology & Creative Industries Together

Hacking for Good? Hacking for Innovation? Yes, its not hacking the Pentagon or MI6... To the contrary - creatives, developers, coders, and entrepreneurs get together, get creative and get to build cool stuff - thats what a HackFest is all about. Hackfest.tv will include 150-200 developers who will be given the simple topic of hacking TV to make it cooler!

We will give them APIs, SDKs and data and challenge them to code/design/engineer/make and break for 48 hours, building their own prototype solutions or ideas. Showers and huge comfy sofas available for a bit of shuteye and cleanup if you plan to stay the entire Friday night! Major Prizes and Chance to Show the TV Industry what TECH can do!

At the end of the hackfest on Saturday, October 27, 2012 at 17:00-18:00, selected teams will do a short presentation of their work to the group of fellow developers, sponsors, judges and press. And then prizes are given on the evening on Saturday during the HackFest wrap-up party
October 26-27, 2012

Who will be attending?

Over 1,000 leading broadcasters, technologists, hackers, storytellers, content creators, brands, researchers and media brands. Some of the biggest and most disruptive players in Transmedia will be facilitating workshops – from Ogilvy Innovation Labs to Portal Entertainment; BBC Writers Room to Young Rewired State; Said Business School to Agora Media. Remember you can apply for be part of London Transmedia Fest 2012 by registering your interest in not only Hackfest but also six others.

Time:

 All APIS (we have 30 from sponsors and open source with another 100 available) will be made available 24 hours before kickoff at 17:00 on Thursday, October 25th. There are options for streaming and storage online from sponsors such as Jet Stream and Cloudsigma so you will have time to prepare any content if you have any and secondly, have a good look at whats there.

You dont have to be there to sign up at 9am on Friday - but you should be there by 17:00 where you can check in and get your badge at the entrance. But you might want to, if you have the time, come and see the Ogilvy exhibition and drop by a few hours earlier as they wont be there on Saturday. The hackathon runs right through until Saturday at 17:00. We will explain more about the judging on Thursday - and there are some very cool prizes which we will announce then.

 

We have room for 100 to spend the night if you so choose. Ravensbourne has showers, nice big comfortable sofas and its not as bad as it sounds.  The hackfest will be on the fourth and sixth floors - with the fourth floor being a chillout space and the sixth floor more bustling.

How It Works -Forming Groups

We are going to run it similarly to Startup Weekend format where we have a microphone out and people can simply start sharing their ideas to the crowd and groups are formed ad hoc - generally.

However, we have also opened up a Linkedin Group which you can see below if you want to start networking early. Start posting on ideas and get to know people ahead of time if you like. Try and keep the groups under six people.

What makes this hackathon more interesting than any other we have seen is the amount of content specialists (transmedia storytellers, producers, writers) and entrepreneurs who have signed up. As well as the usual coders, developers, UX/UI, and design talent usually found at these events. This truly will be an experiment in media convergence and hacking.

Food and Drink

We will be bringing in Pizza on Friday night with drinks and there will be snacks on the Saturday party but theres also a regular bar and some snacks available on site with Ravensbourne staff. Note there will be some free booze as well as Cisco has sponsored drinks on one of the nights.

Get Social!
@tvhackfest is the official Twitter account - #tvhackfest is the hashtag and the short link is http://bit.ly/tvhackfest . Facebook is https://www.facebook.com/TvHackfest

events.name: State of the Mobile Nation
events.about:
This event is supported by Hotwire and Mozilla.

What better time for a review of where were at than the Autumn. Its that back to school feeling and also the start of the build up to the annual mobile industry festival in Barcelona at the end of February. 

We all know mobile is bigger than a very big thing and that the speed of change is faster than anything weve seen in history. But what is actually happening? With so much going on, its easy to miss the real innovations and game-changers in front of our eyes. Wheres the smart money going and why? Whos doing interesting things and how? Will augmented reality take over the world or is it a flash in the pan? Will the machines take over in 2040? And what are we likely to see in the next 12 months that could or should directly affect our strategic thinking? Can Nokia make a come-back? Will HTML5 win the OS war? Does it matter? Will more sectors face collapse or massive change due to the not-so-humble mobile phone?

Join mobile man-about-town and Godfather of Mobile, Russell Buckley and a panel of guests who will debate and discuss all of this and more. There will be time for Q&A.

This session will be live-webcast (subject to, you know, the tech working properly). Registration details will be shared with the sponsors.

Timing:

9.30am Doors open

10am Prompt start

10.45am Session finishes. Time for networking.

Further sessions on mobile advertising and mobile payments will start at 11.15 and 13:00 respectively. Separate RSVP required for each session.

All sessions are free to attend.

Tea, coffee and light refreshments will be provided. 

Although the format is a panel discussion, this is a live recording, so we are limiting spaces to create a more intimate atmosphere and to allow for more discussion and comment from the audience. Therefore, space really is limited so please RSVP to reserve your spot.

Swedish Beers is also happening on 17 October at The Nordic Bar from 6.30pm.

This event forms part of London Mobile Week.

 

About our sponsors

About Hotwire  

 Hotwire is an integrated PR and communications agency. Founded in 2000, the agency spans a number of industries including telecoms, media, marketing, consumer, technology, financial services and cleantech. Quickly becoming a global offering, Hotwire has offices in the UK, across Europe, Australia and the US. Suffice to say, the team are passionate about all things mobile and will be on hand to chew the fat with you.

Mozilla Spaces

 Mozilla Spaces are open working environments where Mozillians can hack,code, design, research, create, engage and contribute to building a brighter future for the web and they are hosting this session. You may be familiar with Mozillas brilliant Firefox browser for desktop and mobile and more recently, they announced their Firefox OS for mobile.

events.name: GeekGirlMeetup Hackathon with The Giving Lab
events.about:
GeekGirlMeetup Hackathon with The Giving Lab

Saturday, October 13th and Sunday, October 14th

Lady-hackers--ever considered using your coding skills for a charitable cause? Join us at General Assembly for a hackathon in collaboration with GeekGirlMeetup and The Giving Lab. For two days we will bring together talented women to develop new methods of charitable giving, whether it be fundraising tools, games, or social media apps. The team with the most promising concept will be awarded a cash prize, classes at General Assembly, access to mentors, and a years free membership to MyNewsDesk. 

GeekGirlMeetup is an un-conference for women about web, code & startups, creating new female role models, networks and active knowledge exchange.

The Giving Lab is an initiative by See the Difference which aims to develop new methods of giving to charity. They are supported by NESTA, Comic Relief, The Baring Foundation, Cabinet Ofice, Nominent Trust, Garfield Weston Foundation, Pears Foundation and Seene.

 

Cant make it? Sign up at http://galondon.com to stay in the loop on future events and classes.

events.name: Off the Rails hack day
events.about:
Loco2 and Bethnal Green Ventures have teamed up to host Off the Rails, a hack day for doing cool stuff with train data and APIs.

The hack day will be held at Campus London (near Old Street/Moorgate, London) on Saturday October 13th.

The day

Well follow a loose format, starting with an introduction to the datasets, code/APIs, and a selection of noteworthy existing applications (please bring your own to show off!).

Developers, designers and ideas people will then break into groups to get hacking. The results will be presented in the evening, all accompanied by free food and drinks

The data

2012 is an exciting year for rail data, with lots of datasets and APIs becoming available that could solve a lot of headaches for train travellers. The UK is leading the way, with Network Rail recently making realtime data available along with existing timetable datasets.

Elsewhere in Europe, the Dutch national rail company, NS, has released an easy-to-use, versatile API, and the Frenchand Germans are beginning to follow suit. And then there’s carbon-footprinting data to help to determine exactly how smug we can all feel for taking the train. There are plenty of ingredients for some exciting apps...

About YOU

We’re looking for enthusiastic train and software geeks, as well as designers and others interested in the worlds of trains, travel and/or sustainability. Everyone is welcome, and all expertise is greatly appreciated so that we can get a good mix of technical and creative minds.

events.name: Hack The Hackathon - AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - London
events.about:
Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

AT&T Mobile App Hackathon, an event produced by Hackathon the Hackathon and AT&T Developer Program that is designed for attendees (technical & non-technical) to build apps/mobile apps, get fed, compete for prizes across different categories and most importantly: meet new people and scout for teammates to work on new or current projects. Our hackathon presents an opportunity to experiment with mobile application development platforms and “smart” devices.

Using motion, voice, and other smartphone-based sensory inputs, and combining them with cloud-based data sources (from social media streams and other feeds), the goal is to help people be more responsive and sensitive toward one another and generally improve the quality of life. Whether you are a student,a professional engineer, a designer, or just have an idea for a cool app or game and want to source a team to give it life, this event will be valuable to you.

We Supply: Quick presentations and code samples that help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake. Along with technical senseis to assist you in building faster, smarter, and with new tools.

You Bring: Your laptop, skills & ideas. Come with a collaborative, team focused mindset and/or team up in advance on Twitter/Facebook/Google+ via the #atthack hashtag. Whether you are a backend person and code in Ruby/PHP/.NET or are a designer and only work with Illustrator, you are invited to attend this event. Every group needs a good balance of talent and your development skills are needed!

Event Schedule.  The following is a list of the weekends agenda:

  • 6PM - Friday Evening - Kickoff event with drinks, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.
  • 10AM - Saturday Morning -  The fun continues with an all day hackathon. Work with the teams that you formed on Friday night to produce the app spec’d out the night before. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution.
  • 10AM - Sunday Morning -  Continue to work with the teams you formed Friday night in order to finish and polish your application. Senseis will be available throughout the entire event to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 4PM.
  • 4PM - Sunday Afternoon - Promptly at 4PM, teams will begin pitching their ventures. Pitches are limited to three (3) minutes per team.

Prizes. Prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge

Judging Criteria. Apps will be judged based on the criteria below and weighted accordingly.  

  • 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does
  • 33% Weight - Originality of idea
  • 33% Weight - Use of Node.JS, Sencha, cloud9ide.com, Heroku, and other technologies
Social Media. 
  • Follow us @hackathonlive for live updates and photos from the event
  • Like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/AttMobileAppHackathon

Speakers

 
   
   
   
   
   
   

Senseis

   
   
   
   
   
   

Sponsors

events.name: Digital Sizzle 6 - Exhibition
events.about:
Those cheeky 3 beards are back!

Firstly, we’ve put on an ambitious ‘Art meets Tech’ hackathon in partnership with Whitechapel Gallery. (Register for the hackathon here, devs/artists!)

Then we’re taking over the ground floor of the prestigious Whitechapel Gallery and it’s going to be the biggest, best & bushiest Digital Sizzle to date!

 

So be you a designer, a coder, a CEO, a policy wonk, a strategist, a planner or any other digital variant, youre invited to network and mingle over a beer and a burger (or soft and vegetarian equivalents) and take a look at what we produced at the hackathon!

We’re not all beer bellies and burger sauce, though! Oh no, as some of you know we love a good bit of chin stroking and so we think there’s some really interesting questions to come out of the Hackathon, and we’ll be talking about these at the Sizzle. For example, can you make “art” from data? Can you make data from art, what is data now that everything is online? What role does art play in the digital economy? What is the digital economy?  Yep, that’s right , this is our most cerebral and biggest sizzle to date.


 

It’s a big venue, with big ideas, big questions and big beards.

Register now and we look forward to chin stroking, belly rubbing and boozing with you all very soon.

events.name: Digital Sizzle 6 - Hackathon
events.about:
Digital Sizzle 6 – Part 1

The ‘Art Meets Tech’ Hackathon


 

Digital Sizzle 6 will bring together around 100 hackers, digital artists and digital musicians to create something amazing over the space of 48 hours.

Using various data sources, APIs and anything else you feel like using, the hackers and artists will be tasked with ‘creating’ using data. The exciting part of this project is that there is no way of knowing what will come out of it!

Weve got some super high level dudes and dudesses who will be mentoring and advising over the weekend, and maybe even lending a helping hand on the projects.

So get your creative juices flowing and get involved in a weekend that could potentially give birth to some truly amazing works...

 

The Prize

The works that are generated over the weekend will be displayed at Digital Sizzle 6 – Part II, which will be held at the Whitechapel Gallery on the 26th September.  If this isn’t enough of a prize we have gone the extra mile and the overall winner of the Hackathon will have the opportunity to be selected for exhibition as part of the innovation and ideas showcase, mounted alongside the annual WIRED magazine conference on October 25th and 26th.


 

Logistics

You need to be available and able to get to central London on:

Friday 14th September from 7pm until 11pm

Saturday 15th September from 9am (ish) until Sunday 16th September 7pm.

Overnight stays can be accommodated on Saturday night only.  Please bring your own sleeping bag and towel (shower available).

The gallery show will be on the 26th September from 7pm - 11pm. 

 

For the hackers: 

Well, if youre the hackers and coders, we know that you need to be looked after in a certain way.  So, all food & drink will be taken care of, and we mean everything: coffee, beer, pizzas, snacks, soft drinks, cereal, et cetera. The mother-effing works!

Alongside that, were bringing in the best of the visualization & data music community. Twilio will be bringing their famously powerful but simple API, a friendly face to help developers get started and enough food and drink to fuel an army! BrandWatch will be giving you all the social media data APIs and mentors you can throw a stick at and Reactify - the experts when it comes to cool generative/reactive/interactive sound that can take influence from all sorts of interesting data - will be on hand to help the frustrated musicians amongst you turn any data streams into music! The choice is yours, all you have to do is show up and get creative! 

So bring your laptop, your favourite development stack, and well pair you up with some artistic talent who are skilled in this arena, to help guide, educate and in some cases, pair-program with you.  You can also bring any hardware that you might want to incorporate - Raspberry Pi, Arduino, second screens etc

We think that language such at MAX/MSP, Processing.js, python, ruby, would be great for the ease of use, but hell, if you wanna go PHP, C#, Fortran, R, on our asses, were not going to complain!

For the artists:

You’ll get all the same lovely food & drink, connectivity and support as your hacker team members, but where they bring the coding skills, you bring the creativity! Come along with your wildest dreams of visualisations, push the boundaries of what you know possible and use the expertise of the hackers to scratch your artistic itch in any way you like.

Provided data goes in and something comes out, anything is fair game: the medium is not set, use whatever you have to create something awesome:

Interactive installation? Fine.

Visual projection? No problem.

Aural interpretation of footfall data at the Olympics? Go for it. 

There will be mentors on hand to consult with and help guide the projects through the weekend, just in case anyone ventures too far into their own imagination (or anyone else’s) and can’t find the way back!

We dont know whats going to come out of the hackathon, all we know is that were super excited to be putting this event on and cannot wait to see what you all come up with - its going to be a real adventure!

events.name: IDEATHON
events.about:
What in tarnation is an Ideathon?

It’s like this. You’ve got an idea, but it’s just that - An idea.  No business model. No brand. No real clue as to how to move forward with it. Ring any bells?! An ideathon is a chance to pitch that idea and, in an afternoon, go from nothing to something. 

What if I don’t have an idea?

If you’re looking to team up with someone with a great concept, this is a fantastic opportunity to hear lots of pitches and get involved at the earliest stage of development.  

 Who should come?

  • If you have an idea– pitch it at one of our events, join forces with people to help develop your idea from nothing to something and maybe even meet your new Co-Founder!

If you don’t- have a current project, you’ll get to hear a load of pitches & you’ll get to work on the one you like – helping to develop it in any way you can – and again, maybe you’ll meet the yin to your yang... the Bonnie to your Clyde... the Adrian to your Rocky. 

How’s it different?

Our events are about rolling up your sleeves and developing a business concept. But! It’s not a hackathon. It’s almost a pre-hackathon. The emphasis is less on building something and more on developing a concept in any way possible, whether it’s a business model, a pitch, a demo, and MVP, UX sketches... You name it.

What’s the catch?

Events are limited to 30 Rockstar-Unicorn-Pirate-Ninjas (Hence the name). We want to keep it small and high quality, so sign up now before it’s too late.

 
And Finally... 
Be sure to join our community on Meetup to meet other like-minded individuals!
 http://bit.ly/SmGmHL

events.name: SportsTech Hack Day
events.about:
After the success of the SportTech Meetup in June were pleased to announce the London Sports Tech Hack Day!

The event will bring together technologies from all sectors and give people the opportunity to mash them up with new open data and brand new exciting services from the world of sports.

The event is organised by Stephen OReilly (Mobile Roadie) and Martyn Davies (SixTwo/Music Hack Day) and takes place on September 8th & 9th at the awesome Mozilla space in central London.

Check out the official page on Hacker League and let us know youre coming onLanyrd.com

Organised by:

events.name: Londinium MMXII Hackathon
events.about:
This summer, the worlds eyes are all on London’s summer of sports.

We expect an increasing volume of social media that generates huge amount of data. Tons of visitors as well as Londoners will be overwhelmed by variety of information. This is a great opportunity for technologists to analyse and visualise such information, as well as create new devices and apps to amplify, manage and make sense of the data in interesting ways.

We are organising a “Hackathon” (“Hack” + “Marathon”) where graphic designers , programmers, journalists, sports enthusiasts, and anyone with cool ideas and data gather in one place during a weekend to create something cool, fun and useful around the theme of London and Sports. At the end of the event, each team or individual pitches their outcome in front of all the participants.

 

See more detail at our web page.

Please also track us at Lanyrd and Follow us on Twitter.

 

NOTE:  Tickets for Demo participants will be released seperately.

events.name: Hackathon London
events.about:
Are you a developer, designer, entrepreneur or startup?

If you are, you’ll want to keep the weekend of Friday June 29th – Sunday 1st July free, because we’re offering you the chance to impress potential investors, employers and peers – and nope, we won’t try to charge you, no matter how much you try to make us.

Investor and award-winning entrepreneur Mark Pearson, is inviting you to The Clove Building, Butlers Wharf, in the shadow of London’s Tower Bridge, where you’ll have 48 hours to develop new ideas or work on a current project with your team.

Mark is the founder and CEO of Markco Media, the company behind MyVoucherCodes.co.uk, and has an ever-extending investment portfolio. His investments, the majority of which are residents of The Clove Building, include companies such as games development firm Noisy Duck, citizen journalism website Blottr.com and mobile application company VouChaCha.

The resident start-ups, including Markco Media, are actively recruiting and will be heavily involved in the weekend.

There’ll be guest mentors throughout the weekend from the world of technology and startups who’ll make themselves available to provide advice and guidance. 

So, if you’re looking for a job with some of the UK’s leading online firms, looking for investment for a project of your own or looking to start your own business and simply want to spend time around other like-minded people, you won’t want to miss Hackathon London, on the weekend of Friday June 29th – Sunday 1st July.

We almost forgot – there’s free food and drink, too.

See you there.....

*************************************************************************

Feedback from the first Hackathon

#hackLDN managed to bring together a fantastic mix of developers, designers and entrepreneurs for a weekend of ideas generation and realisation. The quality of results - applications and potential companies - speaks volumes for the talent we are fortunate enough to have in London and beyond, and the organisational skills of Ben, Mark and everybody at Markco Media, who made the event possible. I’m already looking forward to the next hackathon they put together. 

Phil @leggetter, Developer Evangelist at Pusher

I came to Hackathon London looking to see some cool ideas, and build our own. The ideas that people brought were interesting and I have yet to sleep. The staff from marko media are friendly and have some good ideas and suggestions to help us get our ideas up and running.

Chris Ewbank

Even though I am yet to sleep, I am thoroughly enjoying the event. The progress on our team has been awesome and the constant help and banter from the staff just gives us more motivation to carry on with our project!

Rufus Honour - OverHeard

“It’s been fun, if incredibly tiring, to stay up all night working on a startup. Never had an opportunity like it before - I’d definitely do it again.”

Matt House

Considering I haven’t slept yet, I’m really enjoying Hackathon. I’d like it more if our prototype worked, but hey! You can’t get everything in the world!

events.name: Music Data Science HackCamp: Competition & Hackathon
events.about:
This event is onsite only.

You cant participate remotely.

This event has TWO Streams.

You can only register for one stream. You cant register for both streams.

Both streams will start and end at the same time

1. Stream One: Music Data Science Competition:  3 music business problems. Youll be provided with a large music dataset. You will have to apply your data science skills and knowledge to solve the problem. Best analytical/predictive model wins. Prizes awarded at global and local level.

2. Stream Two: Music Data Science Hackathon: You will be provided with access to ECHONET and OPEN EMI APIs. Do your own hack. A panel of music experts will judge your hack. Best hack according to panel wins prizes.

When: Saturday, June 23, 2012 9:30 AM

Where: The Hub Westminster, First floor, New Zealand House, 80 Haymarket, SW1Y 4TE , London  020 7148 6720http://hubwestminster.net/space  

The venue opens at 9.30 am on Saturday Jun 23rdIf you arrive after 11am you will not be able to participate in the competition.The competition starts at 1pm London time Saturday, June 24thUpon arrival to the venue you will have to register at the reception desk.The reception desk should have your name in the list of participants.If you have not registered in evenbrite you will not be in the list. If you are not in the list, you will not be able to participate. Competition ends June, 24th Sunday at 1pm. Prizes to be announced: Event ends: 3pm

  • You will be provided with 3 proper quality meals, unlimited drinks, coffee & snacks.
  • High-speed 100Mbps Internet will be available
  • Shower facilities and resting area available at the venue
  • Please bring your own laptop.
  • Please bring your own sleeping mattress and sleeping bag.

Useful Information regarding Stream One: Music Data Science Competition: You will be provided with access to the competition web platform. Upon selection of the competition title Data Science Hackathon, you will be able to read the challenge, and access and download the dataset.You can download the dataset to your laptop and you can use your own tools.You will be provided with free access to Amazon AWS cloud services should you choose to run computational jobs there or require more storage capacity. You dont have to use AWS if you dont want. You will provided with free access to EMC/Greenplum Hadoop and Database Community editions and other Greenplum analytical tools. You dont have to use these tools if you dont want to.

events.name: Free Elections Hackathon
events.about:
An event bringing together all the latest developments in how technology can contribute to free and fair elections around the world.

At the moment we have two major projects:

  • Improvements and upgrades to OneWorlds amazing real-time election monitoring system, which they ran successfully in the recent Senegal Presidential elections. If youve not seen this system before, you should definitely check out the website here:  http://www.senevote2012.com/, and watch this video:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fscuy2Tr_mE&feature=relmfu
  • Investigating how technologies such as mobile & cellular communication, crowd-sourced mapping, remote data plotting and covert data transfer can contribute to monitoring of the electoral process in countries where domestic and international observation is restricted. Well be looking particularly at how to address the key issue of corroboration/verification, and running at least a couple of country specific workshops looking at practicalities - Zimbabwe and Iran look likely topics for those at present.
Were currently in dicussions with several other interested organisations about running projects on the day. More details to follow soon.

Any ideas, questions, requests, email me at dan@thesmallaxe.com

events.name: #ulpifkohackathon #hacksthetravelst
events.about:
#ulpifkohackathon is back for the summer of 2012. We have a great hackathon planned out based on travel with new startup Travelst at #ulpifkohackathon #hacksthetravelst.

 

The hottest 10 pairs of hackers line up for 44 hours of non-stop hacking and non-stop coverage of the event hosted by Ulpian Morina and Ivaylo Danev.

 

Meet up with investors, mentors and up-coming talent as the hack-battle for the best travel hack goes underway. It will be THE PLACE to be for Friday to Sunday as the most innovative ideas and concepts on travel take their 44 hour journey from crazy-sounding idea to digital formation.

 

You can take your place as a spectator to be in the zone of this June. You can see what is being developed, how it is being done at the event with a reputation for being the only hackathon that that retains the true hacking culture.

events.name: HACKATHON @ DigitalShoreditch
events.about:
MOBILE HACKATHON Saturday 26th-27th May

Mobile Hackathon at DS2012 

The Cadbury Mobile hack weekend is an amazing opportunity for developers, start ups, mobile geniuses or app dreamers to come together and create new and exciting mobile experiences with one of the nation’s best loved

The prizes

With support from Cadbury, see your mobile creation in the hands of Cadburys millions of fans during the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games.

  • Tickets to the games
  • Samsung Galaxy Notes
  • Your weight in chocolate, a years supply!
  • And many other exciting prizes.

Oh, and of course there will be mountains and fountains of chocolate involved to keep your creativity flowing!

events.name: Unlock London
events.about:
Unlock London Hackathon
//Presented by General Assembly + American Express

Saturday, May 19th  to Sunday May 20th

More info here: london.generalassemb.ly/unlock

General Assembly and American Express welcome developers, designers, and entrepreneurs for a weekend celebrating this fair city by building hacks, apps and websites that help residents and tourists alike unlock the full potential of London. Completed prototypes will then be demonstrated at an on-site event finale and posted online for public consideration.

Cant make it? Sign up at http://galondon.com to stay in the loop on future events and classes.

events.name: Music Tech Fest - 3D Music Hack Camp
events.about:
We are hacking 100 old-school, LED, battery-driven light sabres, mini speakers and other gadgets, and anything you can bring (including a fridge!), together with a series of APIs, including those from Open EMI, BMAT and Decibel. A live band will be present in the hack space in case you want to connect live instruments, and you will have the possibility to use the help of film editors, broadcasters and sound designers for applications which require moving image or particular sounds. 

 
The 3D Music Hack Camp is being organised in conjunction with the London Music Hackspace and will run from Friday to Saturday over night. It will culminate with a 3D Music hacked gadgets party on Saturday night. The best results from the camp will feature at the Sonar festival in Barcelona in June. 
 
 
Joining the 3D Music Hack Camp is free. Register now and bring your sleeping bag!


Register here for Day 1: Synaesthesia Workshops

Register here for Day 2: Demos by startups and talks by major brands

Register here for Day 3: Performances, Demos and Talks

events.name: Hardware Hacking for Entrepreneurs
events.about:
Hardware Hacking for Entrepreneurs // TECH 290 

Daniel Hirschmann, Co-Founder, Technology Will Save Us

Wednesday, May 16th  from 7:00 pm - 8:30 pm.

You spend all day with your hands on a keyboard churning out lines of code or building out business models. Its time to give your hands and your mind some much deserved exercise.

This class will introduce students to the wonderful world of making with hardware and prototyping with technology. Increasingly, start-ups are evolving from purely internet based interactions to more physical experiences. In this session you will learn about creative technology and get your hands dirty with simple demonstrations and sketching in hardware exercises. You will be introduced to basic electronics and be able to move from spreadsheets and business models into a world of physical things.

Daniel Hirschmann is the co-founder of Technology Will Save us where he oversees all aspects of the business with a focus on educational programming and new product development. He has a masters degree from New York Universities ITP prorgamme and has been making interactive installations, spaces and objects for over 10 years. He has worked with organisations ranging from Nike, and AOL to the Science Museum and the Whitney Museum of Art. He has shown his artwork internationally and has taught physical computing, Arduino, programming and interaction design locally and abroad for over 8 years. He geeks out about new businesses and awesome tech.

Cant make it? Sign up at http://galondon.com to stay in the loop on future events and classes.

events.name: MDN Hack Day - London
events.about:
Join Mozillas Developer Engagement team for a day of full-stack Web hackery and good times with HTML5 and friends, Apps & Games, Firefox Addons and Open Web documentation.  

 

What to expect

Well open with talks by developer evangelists on some of the key technology projects we work on. Well give you an idea of what the Mozilla Developer Network is all about. By the time lunch is served you should have a good understanding of:

  • HTML5 Game development 
  • HTML5 Apps & Mozilla Marketplace 
  • Firefox Addons & Developer Tools
  • How to contribute to Open Web Developer Documentation 
  • Identity & Personas 
 
In the afternoon, it will be time to get out your laptop, team up with other like-minded participants and get hacking on a project. If you have questions well be available to help you get going!
 
The crew: Rob Hawkes (@robhawkes), Christian Heilmann (@codepo8), Desigan Chinniah (@cyberdees), Amie Tyrell, Priya Patel and many more folks from Mozilla London.
 

Where well be

Were happy to be able to host this event at our new Mozilla London Office! The MDN Hack Day is just one of a series of events to celebrate the opening of our new MozSpace.

 

Whats included

  • Light breakfast, coffee, lunch & snacks
  • Wifi, AC power

 

What youll need

  • a wifi-capable laptop or device
  • great ideas!
  • lots of questions

events.name: Dart Hackathon - London
events.about:
The Dart team invites you to Happy Hour, the first global Dart hackathon, sponsored by Google and produced by the community. Sign up to participate at one of our many locations across the globe.

Be part of the next evolution of web programming. Make an impact by hacking on Dart and sharing your feedback. The team is eager to learn from you. Join us!

Learn more at the Dart Hackathon site.

events.name: SAP CodeJam London
events.about:
Remember Hacker Night? Well, SAP is bringing it back under a new format called CodeJam. This new concept offers an opportunity for you as a developer to not only get your hands on SAP’s latest technologies but also to put yourself to the test and to code, hack and create with your peers.

 

SAP CodeJam London will focus on Mobile technologies. As a participant, you’ll get access to the entire SAP Mobile Platform including tools, sandboxes, experts, and more! In the days prior to the event, youll receive an email with a checklist and a couple of links that will help you get prepared. Additional information can be found here. 

 

So, put yourself to the test and sign up for CodeJam London now! The event is free, but space is limited.

 

 

Other SAP CodeJam Events:

  • April 23 - SAP CodeJam Berlin (Register)
  • May 1 - SAP CodeJam Tel Aviv (Register)
events.address: 566 Chiswick High Road Building 4, Chiswick Park

events.name: API Hackathon: Learn. Code. Demo.
events.about:
Spend Sunday hacking on the APIs you love. Build an app and demo it in a day. Create a team or code solo. Learn something new. Meet new people. And extend your weekend by celebrating April Fools Day while winning true prizes :-) Free food and beverages will be there too. 

API Demos and Technical Assistance »



                                             

Platform for Vodafone Network APIs                     Developer Tools to Explore Top APIs 

 

                                                Eyewitness Guides, Dictionary & FT APIs           Pusher for Realtime Web and Mobile Appsa


Prizes for Best Apps »

£500 in Apple gift cards for best overall app 

£400 in Apple gift cards for 2nd place

£300 in Apple gift cards for 3rd place 

£400 in Amazon gift cards for best Pearson App


MORE ANNOUNCED SOON 

 

Find a team or go solo, meet new developers and API teams, get coding support, collect swag, build the best thing you can in one day and demo it to the group. Its free and food and drink is provided. Were taking over Kings Cross Hub for a full day of API joy. 

Well have some short technical lightning talks in the morning so you can learn about some new APIs and ask questions from the people that build them. If you have an app idea and need a team member, or dont have a team yet but want to join one, well have an idea pitch session too. Then go code - any language or platform you want, just use APIs and build something awesome. At the end of the day demo what you built and even win some prizes. 

Agenda »

10:00 am: Doors Open! Breakfast, Socializing and Idea Pitch Sessions - Find a Team! 

10:30 am: Lightning Talks - API Pitch Session 

11:00 am: Start Coding!

12:00 pm: Lunch Served

6:30 pm: Demo Your Apps

8:00 pm: Prizes Awarded to Best Apps

events.name: Hackathon London
events.about:
ARE YOU A DEVELOPER,DESIGNER,ENTREPRENEUROR STARTUP?

THIS IS YOUR CHANCE TO IMPRESS EMPLOYERS, INVESTORS AND PEERS

YOULL HAVE 48 HOURS. WORKING IN SMALL TEAMS TO DEVELOP EITHER NEW IDEAS OR WORK ON A CURRENT PROJECT WITH YOUR TEAM.

WEVE GOT SOME GREAT PEOPLE ATTENDING THAT YOU CAN SEEK ADVICE FROM INCLUDING MARK PEARSON, ROB BERRISFORD AND ROSS WILLIAMS.

COME ALONG IF YOU’RE LOOKING FOR A JOB, LOOKING FOR INVESTMENT OR LOOKING TO START A BUSINESS.

events.name: Facebook Mobile HACK - London
events.about:
Join the Facebook Platform team on March 5 in London at RichMix to get hands-on experience building social mobile apps and games.  We’ll be covering both native and mobile web (HTML5) app development. 

During this program, Facebook will host technical deep-dives, a Q&A, and an opportunity for you and your team to hack on site with Facebook Developers Team assistance.  At the end of the day, awards will be given to the best mobile social apps. 

You may start working on your project right now. Your app does not need to be created from scratch at the event. Capacity is limited and we might not be able to accomodate everyone, so register now to secure your space.

The agenda as it stands today:

The current agenda for the day is as follows:

  • Facebook Mobile Platform Overview
  • Native App development (IOS, Android)  
  • Web Apps (HTML5) development
  • PhoneGap
  • Responsive Deign
  • Mobile + Open Graph
  • Partner Presentation
  • Q&A
  • HACK
  • Selection of best apps + Awards

* Please note that this is a very technical event

events.name: Arduino hack day
events.about:
This is a full day of geek centric inspiration, arduino hacking, model building and creative technology awesomeness.  

Iris are hosting the day, Charles and Tom from Sky 1s gadget geeks are providing the inspriation and Nick Weldin will be troubleshooting and supporting your projects and we will keep you topped up with coffee, beer and pizza.

All you have to do is bring your ideas, the bits you need to make it, your skills and your tools and well help you create something to be proud of.

The best idea will be taken to SXSW in Austin Texas and will get pimped around, gaining all the fame and glory that our PR team can create.  

If you need some inspiration on what to make, check these out: 

  • http://hacknmod.com/hack/top-40-arduino-projects-of-the-web/, 
  • http://techcrunch.com/2011/03/14/a-lego-like-light-that-lights-when-you-like/
  • http://arduino.cc/playground/Projects/ArduinoUsers

Happy hacking!

David Caygill Creative Technology Director

Direct:  +44 20 7654 7363

Mobile: +44 7912 898 218

Email:   david.caygill@iris-worldwide.com

Twitter: @dreamfeed

http://www.irisnation.com

events.name: qMedia HACK-A-THON
events.about:
Invitation to qMedia’s first HACK-A-THON!

A FREE one-day exploration in hacking. This is an opportunity to get hands-on experience in microcontroller programming, audio coding, interactive software and experimentation with sensors. Under the guidance of qMedia lecturers and researchers, you will create your own electronics project. The day will end with project presentations and prizes!

Get details, directions and map:  http://qmedia.qmul.ac.uk/hackathon

Space is limited RSVP with a free ticket is required. 

What to expect?

  • In the morning, 
    • meet your qMedia mentors for the day.
    • Form teams & get Arduino kits
    • Start buidling your projects
  • On-site lunch break
  • Projects by qMedia researchers will be on display throughout the day
  • End of the day: 
    • Present your final project to audience of qMedia professors, lectures, PhD researchers, & staff
    • PRIZES AWARDED!!

Details:

  • February 15, 2012
  • 10:00 am – 5:00pm
  • Engineering Building (Entrance facing Mile End Road)
    • Room G.2 (off the main lobby across from the lifts)
    • Directions to Queen Mary University of London
events.address: Electronic Engineering & Computer Science Mile End Road

events.name: London Green Hackathon
events.about:
A weekend of hacking to save the world!

Meet great developers and sustainability experts as we help out our planet with some innovative hacks. Come along, solve problems, and invent new ideas and applications that help address climate change.

See all the details at http://london.greenhackathon.com

events.name: Winter 2012 - Apps for the Games
events.about:
“Apps for the Games” is the focus of the 2012 Winter Hackathon.More than a million people – athletes, media personnel, sports administrators, spectators – will visit London in July/August 2012 for the Olympic Games.

We can assume two things about them: most will want to engage with the city outside of the games, and almost all will have a mobile phone.

We’re devoting our Winter Hackathon in late January 2012 to the creation of mobile apps for these visitors – from event and location finders to shopping and leisure services – to help them to explore and enjoy the delights of the city and surrounding counties.

Apps could include location finders; guides to museums and art galleries; music and theatre guides; routes for walks; guides to historic buildings; booking systems (for shows, restaurants, theatres etc); weather forecasts; guides to shopping and leisure activities… just about anything that will appeal to an Olympic visitor.

Prizes will be awarded for the best app in the following categories:

  • Event Finder
  • Travel Planner
  • Walks and Tours
  • Museums and Attractions
  • London for Free
  • Off the Wall

events.name: Umbraco London Hack day
events.about:
@WeAreAqueduct are hosting a hack day/night in Clerkenwell, London . 

Dates and times are provionsal for now,just had to pick a date. Happy to move around a bit.

We will proivide all the (free!) beer and pizza needed. Just bring a laptop.

We have a massive open plan office above smitfield market, so we have pleanty of space.
